intro: Siphoneugena regnelliana, commonly known as the Regnell's water starwort, is a rare aquatic plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. The plant has a distinctive appearance with whorled leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the summer. It is characterized by its submerged stems and floating leaves, which help it thrive in water environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
